languages.text: "Во времена тьмы Бог-Император замуровал Башню Человечества от чудовищ и нелюдей, дабы обезопасить ее от зла. Но зло успело заронить семя в тысячи тысяч людских душ. И Он запер их в темнице Башни, дабы истребили они прежде зло в своих помыслах. Всю жизнь искупаем мы свою вину перед Богом-Императором. И после смерти вновь возвращаемся на Его Суд. Но то лишь наше бремя, мо{mf|й|я} госпо{mf|дин|жа}. Когда я вижу вас и понимаю, что предо мной стоит сам{mf||а} благословленн{mf|ый|ая} Его дланью помазанни{mf|к|ца} Бож{mf|ий|ия}, нет человека счастливее меня!"

traits.locale_text: "Во времена тьмы Бог-Император замуровал Башню Человечества от демонов, дабы обезопасить ее от зла. Но зло успело заронить семя в тысячи тысяч людских душ. И Он запер их в темнице Башни, дабы истребили они прежде зло в своих помыслах. Всю жизнь искупаем мы свою вину перед Богом-Императором. И после смерти вновь возвращаемся на Его Суд. Но то лишь наше бремя, мо{mf|й|я} госпо{mf|дин|жа}. Когда я вижу вас и понимаю, что предо мной стоит сам благословленный Его дланью Помазанник Божий, нет существа счастливее меня во всех мирах меж солнцем и луной!"

languages.text: "In the time of darkness, the God-Emperor walled up the Tower of Humankind against fiends and monsters to keep it safe from evil. But evil had already planted its seed in thousands upon thousands of human souls. He locked them in the dungeon of the Tower, so that they might first eradicate the evil in their thoughts. All our lives, we atone for our transgression against the God-Emperor. And after death, we return to His judgement. But that is our burden to bear, my {mf|lord|lady}. When I see you and realise that before me stands His anointed, one blessed by His godly hand — there is no one happier than I!"
languages.original_text: "Во времена тьмы Бог-Император замуровал Башню Человечества от чудовищ и нелюдей, дабы обезопасить ее от зла. Но зло успело заронить семя в тысячи тысяч людских душ. И Он запер их в темнице Башни, дабы истребили они прежде зло в своих помыслах. Всю жизнь искупаем мы свою вину перед Богом-Императором. И после смерти вновь возвращаемся на Его Суд. Но то лишь наше бремя, мо{mf|й|я} госпо{mf|дин|жа}. Когда я вижу вас и понимаю, что предо мной стоит сам{mf||а} благословленн{mf|ый|ая} Его дланью помазанни{mf|к|ца} Бож{mf|ий|ия}, нет человека счастливее меня!"

traits.locale_text: "In the time of darkness, the God-Emperor walled up the Tower of Humankind away from fiends and monsters to keep it safe from evil. But evil had already planted its seed in thousands upon thousands of human souls. He locked them in the dungeon of the Tower, so that they would first eradicate the evil in their thoughts. All our lives we atone for our transgression against the God-Emperor. And after death, we return to His judgement. But that is our burden to bear, my {mf|lord|lady}. When I see you and realise that before me stands His anointed, one blessed by His godly hand — there is no one happier than I!"

But evil had already planted its seed in thousands upon thousands of human souls. He locked them in the dungeon of the Tower, so that they would first eradicate the evil in their thoughts. All our lives we atone for our transgression against the God-Emperor. And after death, we return to His judgment. But that is our burden to bear, my {mf|lord|lady}. When I see you and realise that before me stands His anointed, one blessed by His godly hand — there is no creature happier than I in all the worlds between the sun and the moon!"

languages.text: “在黑暗时期，神皇筑起了人类之塔，高墙将无数恶魔、怪物挡在外面，守护人类免受邪恶的侵害。然而，邪恶早已在无数人的灵魂中播下了种子。于是，祂便把人们的灵魂锁在高塔的牢笼里，将他们思想中的罪恶根除。我们这一生，都是在为我们自己赎罪，为我们背叛了祂而赎罪。等我们死后，我们便会接受祂的审判。不过，这仅仅是我们的负担而已。当我看见您的时候，大人，当我意识到您是祂的神选者，被祂的神圣之手亲自赐福过，那一刻起，我便是这世上最幸福的人。”
languages.original_text: "In the time of darkness, the God-Emperor walled up the Tower of Humankind against fiends and monsters to keep it safe from evil. But evil had already planted its seed in thousands upon thousands of human souls. He locked them in the dungeon of the Tower, so that they might first eradicate the evil in their thoughts. All our lives, we atone for our transgression against the God-Emperor. And after death, we return to His judgement. But that is our burden to bear, my {mf|lord|lady}. When I see you and realise that before me stands His anointed, one blessed by His godly hand — there is no one happier than I!"

traits.locale_text: “在黑暗时期，神皇筑起了人类之塔，高墙将无数恶魔、怪物挡在外面，守护人类免受邪恶的侵害。然而，邪恶早已在无数人的灵魂中播下了种子。于是，祂便把人们的灵魂锁在高塔的牢笼里，将他们思想中的罪恶根除。我们这一生，都是在为我们自己赎罪，为我们背叛了祂而赎罪。等我们死后，我们便会接受祂的审判。不过，这仅仅是我们的负担而已。当我看见您的时候，大人，当我意识到您是祂的神选者，被祂的神圣之手亲自赐福过，那一刻起，我便是这世上最幸福的人。”

languages.text: «En tiempos de gran oscuridad, el Dios Emperador amuralló la Torre de la Humanidad para protegerla de todo tipo de monstruos. Pero el mal ya había echado raíces en miles y miles de almas humanas. Él las encerró a todas en la mazmorra de la Torre, a fin de erradicar la maldad que había infestado sus mentes. Vivimos para expiar nuestra afrenta al Dios Emperador. Y después de la muerte, comparecemos ante Él para que nos juzgue. Pero esa es la carga que hemos de soportar, {mf|milord|milady}. Cuando le miro a usted y soy consciente de que tengo ante mí a Su {mf|elegido, aquél|elegida, aquella} que ha sido {mf|bendecido|bendecida} por Su santísima mano... ¡no quepo en mí de gozo!».
languages.original_text: "In the time of darkness, the God-Emperor walled up the Tower of Humankind against fiends and monsters to keep it safe from evil. But evil had already planted its seed in thousands upon thousands of human souls. He locked them in the dungeon of the Tower, so that they might first eradicate the evil in their thoughts. All our lives, we atone for our transgression against the God-Emperor. And after death, we return to His judgement. But that is our burden to bear, my {mf|lord|lady}. When I see you and realise that before me stands His anointed, one blessed by His godly hand — there is no one happier than I!"

Vivimos para expiar nuestra afrenta al Dios Emperador. Y después de la muerte, comparecemos ante Él para que nos juzgue. Pero esa es la carga que hemos de soportar, {mf|milord|milady}. Cuando le miro a usted y soy consciente de que tengo ante mí a Su {mf|elegido, aquél|elegida, aquella} que ha sido {mf|bendecido|bendecida} por Su santísima mano... ¡no quepo en mí de gozo!».

languages.text: "Karanlık çağda Tanrı İmparator, İnsanlık Kulesi'ni kötülükten korumak için iblislere ve canavarlara karşı duvarlarla çevrelemiş. Ancak kötülük tohumunu çoktan binlerce, on binlerce insan ruhuna ekmiş olduğundan önce düşüncelerindeki kötülüğü yok edebilmeleri için onları Kule'nin zindanına kilitlemiş. Hayatımız boyunca Tanrı İmparator'a karşı işlediğimiz günahların kefaretini öder, ölümden sonra O'nun yargısına döneriz. Bu bizim taşımamız gereken yüktür {mf|lordum|leydim}. Sizi gördüğümde ve önümde O'nun kutsanmışının, O'nun ilahi eliyle kutsanmış birinin durduğunu fark ettiğimde dünyanın en mutlu insanı oldum!"
languages.original_text: "In the time of darkness, the God-Emperor walled up the Tower of Humankind against fiends and monsters to keep it safe from evil. But evil had already planted its seed in thousands upon thousands of human souls. He locked them in the dungeon of the Tower, so that they might first eradicate the evil in their thoughts. All our lives, we atone for our transgression against the God-Emperor. And after death, we return to His judgement. But that is our burden to bear, my {mf|lord|lady}. When I see you and realise that before me stands His anointed, one blessed by His godly hand — there is no one happier than I!"

languages.text: 「暗黒の時代、神帝陛下は、悪から身を守るために悪霊やモンスターに対抗するための人類の塔を建設しました。しかし、悪はすでに数千の人間の魂の中にその種を植えていました。陛下は塔の迷宮に彼らを閉じ込め、彼らがまずはその思考の中に持つ悪を根絶するようにしました。私たちは皆、神帝陛下に対する罪の償いをします。そして死後、私たちは彼の裁きに戻るのです。しかし、天の{mf|君|姫}、それは私たちが耐えなければならない試練なのです。あなたにお会いして、陛下の神の手による祝福を受けた陛下の後継者が私の前に立っていることを自覚すると、私よりも幸福な人などいません！」
languages.original_text: "In the time of darkness, the God-Emperor walled up the Tower of Humankind against fiends and monsters to keep it safe from evil. But evil had already planted its seed in thousands upon thousands of human souls. He locked them in the dungeon of the Tower, so that they might first eradicate the evil in their thoughts. All our lives, we atone for our transgression against the God-Emperor. And after death, we return to His judgement. But that is our burden to bear, my {mf|lord|lady}. When I see you and realise that before me stands His anointed, one blessed by His godly hand — there is no one happier than I!"

traits.locale_text: 「暗黒の時代、神帝陛下は、悪から身を守るために悪霊やモンスターに対抗するための人類の塔を建設しました。しかし、悪はすでに数千の人間の魂の中にその種を植えていました。陛下は塔の迷宮に彼らを閉じ込め、彼らがまずはその思考の中に持つ悪を根絶するようにしました。私たちは皆、神帝陛下に対する罪の償いをします。そして死後、私たちは彼の裁きに戻るのです。しかし、天の{mf|君|姫}、それは私たちが耐えなければならない試練なのです。あなたにお会いして、陛下の神の手による祝福を受けた陛下の後継者が私の前に立っていることを自覚すると、私よりも幸福な人などいません！」

languages.text: « Lorsque régnaient les ténèbres, l'Empereur-Dieu a érigé un mur autour de la tour de l'humanité afin de repousser les monstres et les démons et de la protéger du mal. Malheureusement, les germes du mal avaient déjà été plantés dans des milliers d'âmes humaines, alors Il les a enfermées dans le cachot de la tour, afin qu'elles puissent d'abord éradiquer le malin de leurs pensées. Nous devons consacrer notre vie à expier cette transgression, et lorsque nous mourons, nous nous soumettons à Son jugement. Mais c'est notre fardeau, Votre Seigneurie. Rien ne me rend plus heureuse que de vous voir, vous, Son {mf|élu|élue}, un être béni par Sa main divine même ! »
languages.original_text: "In the time of darkness, the God-Emperor walled up the Tower of Humankind against fiends and monsters to keep it safe from evil. But evil had already planted its seed in thousands upon thousands of human souls. He locked them in the dungeon of the Tower, so that they might first eradicate the evil in their thoughts. All our lives, we atone for our transgression against the God-Emperor. And after death, we return to His judgement. But that is our burden to bear, my {mf|lord|lady}. When I see you and realise that before me stands His anointed, one blessed by His godly hand — there is no one happier than I!"

traits.locale_text: « Lorsque régnaient les ténèbres, l'Empereur-Dieu a érigé un mur autour de la tour de l'humanité afin de repousser les monstres et les démons et de la protéger du mal. Malheureusement, les germes du mal avaient déjà été plantés dans des milliers d'âmes humaines, alors Il les a enfermées dans le cachot de la tour, afin qu'elles puissent d'abord éradiquer le malin de leurs pensées. Nous devons consacrer notre vie à expier cette transgression, et lorsque nous mourons, nous nous soumettons à Son jugement. Mais c'est notre fardeau, Votre Seigneurie. Rien ne me rend plus heureuse que de vous voir, vous, Son {mf|élu|élue}, un être béni par Sa main divine même ! »

languages.text: "In der Zeit der Dunkelheit hat der Gottimperator den Turm der Menschheit gegen Unholde und Monster abgeschottet, um ihn vor dem Bösen zu bewahren. Doch das Böse hatte seine Saat bereits in Tausenden und Abertausenden von menschlichen Seelen eingepflanzt. Diese armen Seelen hat Er im Verlies des Turms eingesperrt, damit sie zunächst das Böse aus ihren Gedanken tilgen können. Unser ganzes Leben lang tun wir Buße für unsere Sünde am Gottimperator. Und nach unserem Tod urteilt Er über uns. Doch das ist unsere Bürde, {mf|mein Herr|meine Herrin}. Wenn ich Euch sehe und erkenne, dass {mf|Sein Auserwählter|Seine Auserwählte} vor mir steht, von seiner göttlichen Hand gesegnet, dann ist niemand glücklicher als ich!"
languages.original_text: "In the time of darkness, the God-Emperor walled up the Tower of Humankind against fiends and monsters to keep it safe from evil. But evil had already planted its seed in thousands upon thousands of human souls. He locked them in the dungeon of the Tower, so that they might first eradicate the evil in their thoughts. All our lives, we atone for our transgression against the God-Emperor. And after death, we return to His judgement. But that is our burden to bear, my {mf|lord|lady}. When I see you and realise that before me stands His anointed, one blessed by His godly hand — there is no one happier than I!"
